intro: Malache chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas malache, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered growth habit. The plant typically features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that develop into edible fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical study is important for understanding biodiversity in understudied tropical ecosystems.
